intro: Dolicholobium oxylobum var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent dolicholobium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy or pubescent leaves, which give it its varietal name. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a distinct central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
